import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.style.use('fivethirtyeight')
plt.style.use('dark_background')
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go

## Importing LuciferML
from luciferml.supervised.classification import Classification 

import warnings
warnings.simplefilter(action='ignore', category=Warning)

source.c291deb5:
params = {'C': 1.623776739188721, 'penalty': 'l2', 'solver': 'saga'}
classifier =  Classification(predictor = 'lr',params=params)
classifier.fit(features, labels)
result = classifier.result()
accuracy_scores[result['Classifier']] = result['Accuracy']
source.54ac03b3:
params = {'C': 11.288378916846883, 'gamma': 0.001, 'kernel': 'linear'}
classifier =  Classification(predictor = 'svm',params=params)
classifier.fit(features, labels)
result = classifier.result()
accuracy_scores[result['Classifier']] = result['Accuracy']
source.a4e0642a:
params = {'algorithm': 'auto', 'n_jobs': 1, 'n_neighbors': 6, 'weights': 'distance'}
classifier =  Classification(predictor = 'knn',params=params)
classifier.fit(features, labels)
result = classifier.result()
accuracy_scores[result['Classifier']] = result['Accuracy']
source.c7e6b42a:
params = {'criterion': 'entropy', 'max_depth': 15, 'max_features': 2, 'splitter': 'best', 'random_state': 42}
classifier =  Classification(predictor = 'dt',params=params)
classifier.fit(features, labels)
result = classifier.result()
accuracy_scores[result['Classifier']] = result['Accuracy']

params = {'criterion': 'gini', 'max_features': 'auto', 'n_estimators': 150,'random_state':0}
classifier =  Classification(predictor = 'rfc',params=params)
classifier.fit(features, labels)
result = classifier.result()
accuracy_scores[result['Classifier']] = result['Accuracy']
source.0ed97862:
params = {'learning_rate':0.02, 'n_estimators':600, 'objective':'binary:logistic', 'eval_metric':'logloss', 'nthread':-1}
classifier =  Classification(predictor = 'xgb',params=params)
classifier.fit(features, labels)
result = classifier.result()
accuracy_scores[result['Classifier']] = result['Accuracy']

print('The model with highest K-Fold Validation Accuracy score is  {0} with an accuracy of  {1:.2f}'.format(
    maxKey, accuracy_scores[maxKey]))

LuciferML

This is my own ML-Library whose purpose is to take away all your hassles and does all the hard work for you. It's currently in development stage. Preprocesses and Trains different models on your Data. More about LuciferML here

source.64edcffe: Importing Dataset
source.49c8f077:
About the Dataset

This is a dataset consisting of several features of stars. Some of them are:

  • Absolute Temperature (in K)
  • Relative Luminosity (L/Lo)
  • Relative Radius (R/Ro)
  • Absolute Magnitude (Mv)
  • Star Color (white,Red,Blue,Yellow,yellow-orange etc)
  • Spectral Class (O,B,A,F,G,K,,M)
  • Star Type **(Red Dwarf, Brown Dwarf, White Dwarf, Main Sequence , SuperGiants, HyperGiants)**
  • Lo = 3.828 x 10^26 Watts (Avg Luminosity of Sun)
  • Ro = 6.9551 x 10^8 m (Avg Radius of Sun)
